com.sap.cloud.sdk.cloudplatform.connectivity

Class DestinationAccessor

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.sap.cloud.sdk.cloudplatform.connectivity.DestinationAccessor

  • public final class DestinationAccessor
extends Object
    Wrapper for an DestinationFacade, offering methods to conveniently declare and get destinations.

        Parameters:

      • declareDestinations

        public static void declareDestinations(String... destinationNames)
        Delegates to declareDestinations(Collection).
        Parameters:
        destinationNames - The names of all destination that should get declared.

      • declareDestinations

        public static void declareDestinations(Collection<String> destinationNames)
        Declares the given destination names. Among potential pre-fetching of configurations for performance optimizations, declaring destinations is used to ensure that destinations can be retrieved correctly on all supported Cloud platforms when working with non-container managed threads. It should always be invoked before any calls to getDestination(String) and getDestinationsByName(), for example, during application startup within a ServletContextListener.

        Notes:

        • Calls to this methods are idempotent. In particular, declaring a destination multiple times results in the destination being declared once without any side effects.
        • Declared destinations do not require an existing configuration, however, a missing destination configuration for a declared destination can result in certain warnings being logged.
        Parameters:
        destinationNames - The collection of all destination names that should get declared.
        See Also:
        DestinationDeclarator, RequestContext, DestinationsRequestContextListener

      • getDestinationType

        public static DestinationType getDestinationType(String destinationName)
                                          throws DestinationNotFoundException,
                                                 DestinationAccessException
        Returns the DestinationType of the destination with the given name.
        Parameters:
        destinationName - The destination name to get the destination type for.
        Returns:
        The type of the destination with the given name.
        Throws:
        DestinationNotFoundException - If no destination with the given name can be found.
        DestinationAccessException - If there is an issue while accessing destination information.

      • getGenericDestination

        public static GenericDestination getGenericDestination(String destinationName)
                                                throws DestinationNotFoundException,
                                                       DestinationAccessException
        Returns the GenericDeclaration for the given name.
        Parameters:
        destinationName - The destination name to get the associated destination for.
        Returns:
        The destination with the given name.
        Throws:
        DestinationNotFoundException - If the GenericDeclaration cannot be found.
        DestinationAccessException - If there is an issue while accessing destination information.

      • getDestination

        public static Destination getDestination(String destinationName)
                                  throws DestinationNotFoundException,
                                         DestinationAccessException
        Returns the Destination for the given name.

        Note: The destination must be of type DestinationType.HTTP, otherwise an exception is thrown. You can check the type of the destination with getDestinationType(String).

        Parameters:
        destinationName - The destination name to the get the HTTP-destination for.
        Returns:
        The HTTP-destination for the given destination name.
        Throws:
        DestinationNotFoundException - If the Destination cannot be found.
        DestinationAccessException - If the destination is not of type DestinationType.HTTP or there is an issue while accessing destination information.

      • getRfcDestination

        public static RfcDestination getRfcDestination(String destinationName)
                                        throws DestinationNotFoundException,
                                               DestinationAccessException
        Returns the RfcDestination for the given name.

        Note: The destination must be of type DestinationType.RFC, otherwise an exception is thrown. You can check the type of the destination with getDestinationType(String).

        Parameters:
        destinationName - The destination name to get the RFC-destination for.
        Returns:
        The RFC-destination for the given destination name.
        Throws:
        DestinationNotFoundException - If the RfcDestination cannot be found.
        DestinationAccessException - If the destination is not of type DestinationType.RFC or there is an issue while accessing destination information.

      • getGenericDestinationsByName

        public static Map<String,? extends GenericDestination> getGenericDestinationsByName()
                                                                             throws DestinationAccessException
        Returns all known destinations by their names, irrespective of their type.
        Returns:
        A map containing all destinations indexed by their name.
        Throws:
        DestinationAccessException - If there is an issue while accessing destination information.

      • getDestinationsByName

        public static Map<String,Destination> getDestinationsByName()
                                                     throws DestinationAccessException
        Returns all known Destinations that are of type DestinationType.HTTP by their names.

        To get all destinations, irrespective of their type, use getGenericDestinationsByName().

        Returns:
        A map containing all HTTP-destinations indexed by their name.
        Throws:
        DestinationAccessException - If there is an issue while accessing destination information.

      • getRfcDestinationsByName

        public static Map<String,RfcDestination> getRfcDestinationsByName()
                                                           throws DestinationAccessException
        Returns all known RfcDestinations that are of type DestinationType.RFC by their names.

        To get all destinations, irrespective of their type, use getGenericDestinationsByName().

        Returns:
        A map containing all RFC-destinations indexed by their name.
        Throws:
        DestinationAccessException - If there is an issue while accessing destination information.
